items.q: Does Mrs. Ford want any butter?
Doesn't Mrs. Ford want a tin of tomato soup?
Has the grocer any tomato soup?
Are there any tins on the shelf?
Do these tins contain tomato soup?
Will the grocer send the things to Mrs. Ford's house?
Can he send the eggs too?
Does Mrs. Ford want some biscuits or some bread?
items.a: Mrs. Ford wants some biscuits but she doesn’t want any bread.

items.q: Does she want a tin of tomato soup or a tin of tomatoes?
items.a: She wants a tin of tomato soup but she doesn’t want a tin of tomatoes.

items.q: Are the tins on the shelf or on the counter?
items.a: The tins are on the counter but they are not on the shelf.

items.q: Will the grocer send the things or will Mrs. Ford carry them?
items.a: Mrs. Ford will carry the things but the grocer will not send them.

items.q: Will Mrs. Ford take the eggs with her or will the grocer send them?
items.a: Mrs. Ford will carry the eggs but the grocer will not.

items.q: Who wants some butter and cheese?
items.a: Mrs. Ford wants some butter and cheese.

items.q: Who will send the things to Mrs. Ford's house?
items.a: Mrs. Ford will carry the things.
Mrs. Ford will carry the eggs.
The delivery boy is very careless.
